‚úíÔ∏èClaire M. DavisüñãÔ∏è
posts.content:
If your VP just left  or was ‚Äúasked‚Äù to go 
‚Ä¶layoffs may be coming.
Follow these 8 steps‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶to stay in action and guard your mindset

(And thank youfor the fantastic mindset question)


1. Gather wins and contacts

...do this immediately after finding out about a layoff, if you hear rumblings, or if your VP suddenly ‚Äúleaves.‚Äù Restructuring is likely to follow.

2. Start a networking plan

‚Ä¶we love the 5-5-5 (see my about section for a link)

3. Help someone else

‚Ä¶it sets off a chain reaction in your brain that is empowering and mood-boosting ‚Äî and builds goodwill that will be reciprocated 9 times out of 10

4. Organize finances

‚Ä¶what subs can you let go of for the time being to feel more ‚Äúin control‚Äù of your life until checks start coming in again

5. Get specific about your next step and WRITE IT DOWN

‚Ä¶now gear all your strategy, moves, and networking around that goal.

6. Do not wait out that severance

‚Ä¶That 6-12 months will be up before you know it and you‚Äôll be no closer to your goal by letting your recent results linger.

7. Edify/Thank Others

‚Ä¶now is the time to send TY notes, write your team testimonials, and reach out in good faith. It builds reciprocity and is linked to boosting your morale, mood, and productivity.


Before you do any ‚Äúself-care‚Äù
after a layoff, stay in action
so you don‚Äôt get stuck.

Xo
Claire

5X Layoff Survivor

comments.commentText: Yep, you gotta know when it's time to prepare. Hopefully, '25 will be a year of rebuilding and companies hiring for execution and customer success, not bowing down to Black Rock.
John Michaels here‚Äôs to that! Yes!
Keeping track of your wins and networking throughout your key is so important. I only wish I knew the value of both of these actions sooner Ô∏èClaire M. DavisÔ∏è
Vendela Dubin girlfriend I SO get it ‚Äî LMK if you‚Äôd ever like support (though I know you‚Äôve got this dialed in now!)

posts.commentAdded: Great insights, Claire! Staying proactive is key during uncertain times. Thanks for sharing these actionable steps! #CareerResilience

posts.name:
Adi Saric
Adi Saric
posts.content:
Reimagining Insurance with Embedded Finance: A Win-Win for Businesses and Customers 

Imagine buying a product online and seamlessly adding insurance at checkout, or securing car coverage directly through your favorite ride-hailing app. This is the transformative potential of embedded insurance - bringing protection to customers at the right moment, in the right context, without friction.

By integrating insurance services into everyday platforms like e-commerce websites, mobile apps, and IoT devices, companies are creating personalized, data-driven solutions that revolutionize how we think about coverage.

 Key Benefits:
- Convenience: Insurance is offered exactly when and where it‚Äôs needed.
- Personalization: IoT and telematics enable better risk assessment and tailored pricing.
- Efficiency: Businesses save on infrastructure while gaining faster time-to-market.
- Insights: Advanced data capabilities unlock deeper customer understanding.

Embedded insurance isn‚Äôt just a feature; it‚Äôs a new way to build trust, loyalty, and value in every customer interaction.

 What industries do you think will benefit the most from embedded insurance in the next 5 years? Let‚Äôs discuss!

comments.commentText: E-commerce platforms are becoming ecosystems, thanks to embedded finance and insurance.

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! I believe e-commerce and mobility sectors will see the most impact from embedded insurance‚Äîstreamlining safety for consumers everywhere!

posts.name:
Chana Grossman
Chana Grossman
posts.content:
Recruiting is a rollercoaster.

One day, you feel on top of the world‚Äîyou connect a perfect-fit candidate with a dream job, the client is thrilled, and everything clicks into place. Then, there are the tougher days‚Ä¶when things don‚Äôt go as planned. A role shifts, priorities change, or that amazing candidate decides to pursue another opportunity.

It‚Äôs a constant balance of highs and lows, but one thing remains true: every challenge is an opportunity to learn, adapt, and grow. Success in recruiting isn‚Äôt just about filling roles‚Äîit‚Äôs about resilience, relationships, and always keeping your eye on the bigger picture.

To my fellow recruiters and job seekers, how do you stay motivated through the ups and downs?

Let‚Äôs share tips and stories‚Äîwe all have them!

comments.commentText: Chana Grossman, I love your posts! you always have such true life day to days, put down in such a beautiful way, Keep it up!!

posts.commentAdded: Great post! Staying adaptable and focused on relationships helps me through the rollercoaster. Excited to hear others strategies too! üé¢‚ú®

posts.name:
Ranveer Allahbadia
Ranveer Allahbadia
posts.content:
Hard advice but true advice.

Having trouble convincing your parents?

comments.commentText:
You are partially right. Some of us come from a generation where deviating from the goals our parents set for us was not even an option. For those who succeeded in proving their inner strength, it took tremendous effort; one that, for many, felt overwhelmingly heavy compared to their own desires, leading them to prefer following the commands instead.
After becoming a parent, I allowed myself to listen to my child's desires. I truly believe that anything done with passion brings success and satisfaction, which can be both financially and mentally rewarding.

posts.commentAdded: Sometimes, the toughest conversations lead to the most rewarding outcomes. Keep pushing forward! üí™ #CommunicationSkills

posts.commentAdded: Such a powerful insight! Emphasizing grit and teachability truly unlocks potential. Grateful for mentors who guide us on this journey! üí°

posts.content:
ùóöùó∂ùòÉùó≤ ùó†ùó≤ ùóüùó≤ùòÄùòÄ ùóßùóµùóÆùóª ùü± ùó†ùó∂ùóªùòÇùòÅùó≤ùòÄ ‚Äî ùóú‚Äôùóπùóπ ùóúùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅùó∂ùó≥ùòÜ ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ùó£ùó∂ùòÅùó∞ùóµ ùóÆùóªùó± ùóôùòÇùóªùó±ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóïùóπùó∂ùóªùó± ùó¶ùóΩùóºùòÅùòÄ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ùóßùó≤ùó∞ùóµ ùó¶ùòÅùóÆùóøùòÅùòÇùóΩ

You‚Äôre a first-time tech CEO. Your product is groundbreaking. Your vision is clear. You‚Äôre ready to scale.
ùóïùòÇùòÅ ùó≤ùòÉùó≤ùóøùòÜ ùó∂ùóªùòÉùó≤ùòÄùòÅùóºùóø ùóΩùó∂ùòÅùó∞ùóµ ùó≥ùó≤ùó≤ùóπùòÄ ùóπùó∂ùó∏ùó≤ ùóÆ ùòÄùóµùóºùòÅ ùó∂ùóª ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùó±ùóÆùóøùó∏.
Rejection emails pile up. Silence stings.
You‚Äôre left asking:
‚ÄúWhat am I missing?‚Äù
ùóßùóµùó≤ ùóÆùóªùòÄùòÑùó≤ùóø? ùóïùóπùó∂ùóªùó± ùòÄùóΩùóºùòÅùòÄ.
And identifying them might be the most valuable 5 minutes you spend this year.
ùü≠. ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ùó¶ùòÅùóºùóøùòÜ ùó∂ùòÄ ùóñùóºùó∫ùóΩùóπùó∂ùó∞ùóÆùòÅùó≤ùó±. ùó¶ùó∂ùó∫ùóΩùóπùó∂ùó≥ùòÜ ùóúùòÅ.
Investors should understand your startup‚Äôs purpose in under 30 seconds. If you lose them in complexity, you lose them entirely.
 Blind Spot Fix: Clarify your narrative. What urgent problem are you solving, and why does it matter?
ùüÆ. ùó¨ùóºùòÇ‚Äôùóøùó≤ ùóôùóºùó∞ùòÇùòÄùó≤ùó± ùóºùóª ùóôùó≤ùóÆùòÅùòÇùóøùó≤ùòÄ, ùó°ùóºùòÅ ùó©ùó∂ùòÄùó∂ùóºùóª.
Tech is exciting, but investors fund big futures, not features. They need to believe in the impact your startup will make.
 Blind Spot Fix: Paint a vision of market dominance. What future are they buying into?
ùüØ. ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ‚Äúùó™ùóµùòÜ ùó†ùó≤?‚Äù ùó∂ùòÄ ùó™ùó≤ùóÆùó∏.
Investors are betting on you as much as the product. If you can‚Äôt explain why you‚Äôre the CEO to lead this, they won‚Äôt invest.
 Blind Spot Fix: Show your unique edge ‚Äî your experience, grit, and why you‚Äôll see this through.
ùü∞. ùóñùóºùóªùó≥ùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùó∞ùó≤ ùóúùòÄùóª‚ÄôùòÅ ùóñùóºùó∫ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóßùóµùóøùóºùòÇùó¥ùóµ.
Doubt in your voice or body language plants doubt in their minds. Confidence isn‚Äôt optional ‚Äî it‚Äôs contagious.
 Blind Spot Fix: Deliver your pitch with conviction. If you don‚Äôt believe, why should they?
ùü±. ùó¨ùóºùòÇ‚Äôùóøùó≤ ùó†ùó∂ùòÄùòÄùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóõùóºùóºùó∏.
Your pitch needs a moment that grabs investors and makes them think, ‚ÄúI need to know more.‚Äù
 Blind Spot Fix: Lead with a powerful hook ‚Äî a compelling fact, question, or vision that demands attention.
These Blind Spots are Costing You Funding. Fix Them Now.

I‚Äôve helped first-time tech CEOs transform their pitches with ùó∫ùòÜ ùóΩùóøùóºùóΩùóøùó∂ùó≤ùòÅùóÆùóøùòÜ ùó¶ùóßùóîùó•ùóßùó®ùó£‚Ñ¢ ùó£ùó∂ùòÅùó∞ùóµ ùó¶ùòÜùòÄùòÅùó≤ùó∫ ‚Äî a proven framework that works:
 Simplifies your story for instant clarity.
 Highlights your vision for market domination.
 Projects unshakable confidence and shows why you are the right CEO.

ùó•ùó≤ùóÆùó±ùòÜ ùòÅùóº ùóúùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅùó∂ùó≥ùòÜ ùó¨ùóºùòÇùóø ùóïùóπùó∂ùóªùó± ùó¶ùóΩùóºùòÅùòÄ?
Ask yourself:
(1) Can I explain my startup‚Äôs vision in 30 seconds?
(2) Does my pitch inspire confidence and excitement?
(3) Am I projecting the confidence of a leader investors can trust?
If not, it‚Äôs time for a change.

 ùó•ùó≤ùóÆùó± ùóñùóÆùòÄùó≤ ùó¶ùòÅùòÇùó±ùòÜ: Pitch Desk and Tech Startup Funding Strategies for Fundraising Success.

Your breakthrough is waiting.

posts.content:
Empathy-Driven Decision-Making with OKRs

 OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) work best when they reflect the human experience behind the goals, not just the targets and metrics.

An example:
 Instead of: ‚ÄúIncrease product delivery speed by 20%,‚Äù
Try: ‚ÄúEmpower cross-functional teams to collaborate faster by streamlining our review process, improving employee satisfaction, and reducing burnout.‚Äù

If you want to reimagine your OKRs to drive both business outcomes and team fulfillment, let‚Äôs connect!

You can see testimonials from leaders I‚Äôve partnered with here:

comments.commentText: Streamlining processes might significantly impact productivity and morale.

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Integrating empathy into OKRs not only boosts performance but also enhances team morale. Let‚Äôs drive impactful change together!

posts.name:
Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
Garett Moreau üá∫üá∏
posts.content:
A Ch!na-aligned APT group dubbed PlushDaemon has executed a supply-chain attack on IPany by embedding a sophisticated backdoor named SlowStepper into its installer.

PlushDaemon is known for hijacking legitimate software updates and exploiting vulnerabilities in web servers to gain access. The IPany compromise "represents a significant shift in its tactics" marking its first observed supply-chain attack.

This has all the earmarks of a state-sponsored cyber-attack. Will update later this afternoon.
posts.commentAdded: Interesting development! It highlights the growing sophistication of supply-chain attacks. Looking forward to your updates on this situation.
